item.title: 特斯拉的季度业绩：投资者和车迷在看什么？
item.description: 特斯拉可能在本周三公布其十多年来最大的季度收入降幅，因为这家电动汽车制造商正在努力解决竞争加剧、缺乏新车型以及消费者对首席执行官埃隆-马斯克的反弹等问题。【原文：Tesla is likely to post its biggest drop in quarterly revenue in more than a decade on Wednesday, as the EV maker grapples with issues including increased competition, a lack of new models and consumer backlash against CEO Elon Musk.】

item.title: 英特尔芯片承包计划成为财报日焦点
item.description: 面对下滑的季度销售额和不断扩大的亏损，英特尔的股东们一定想知道新任首席执行官李布天对这家芯片制造商新生的合同制造业务有何计划。【原文：Faced with slumping quarterly sales and a burgeoning loss, Intel shareholders will want to know new CEO Lip Bu-Tan's plans for the chipmaker's nascent contract manufacturing business.】

item.title: 聚焦：绿色氢气退却对排放目标构成威胁
item.description: 绿色氢气开发商正在全球范围内取消项目和削减投资，这使得对化石燃料的依赖可能会超过预定目标。【原文：Green hydrogen developers are cancelling projects and trimming investments around the world, raising the prospect of longer than targeted reliance on fossil fuels.】

item.title: 被取消和推迟的绿色氢能项目
item.description: 由于生产成本上升以及对低碳燃料的需求疲软，许多绿色氢气开发商已经在全球范围内缩减了投资并取消了项目。【原文：Developers of green hydrogen have scaled back investments and scrapped projects globally as elevated production costs and weak demand for the low-carbon fuel have made many ventures unviable.】

item.title: 台湾贸易代表团赴华盛顿就潜在关税和贸易协议进行会谈
item.description: 台湾政府周三表示，由副总理率领的贸易代表团已抵达华盛顿特区，本周将与美国官员进行新一轮当面谈判。【原文：Taiwan's government said on Wednesday that a trade delegation led by the vice premier was in Washington, D.C., for a new round of in-person negotiations with U.S. officials this week.】

item.title: 澳大利亚慧科公司（WiseTech）在人工智能驱动的效率提升中裁减部分岗位
item.description: 澳大利亚慧科全球公司（WiseTech Global）周三证实，作为劳动力审查的一部分，该公司正在裁减一些职位，重点是 "通过自动化和使用人工智能最大限度地提高效率"。【原文：Australia's WiseTech Global confirmed on Wednesday it was cutting some roles as part of a workforce review to focus on "maximizing efficiency via automation and use of artificial intelligence".】

item.title: 关税风险给芯片需求前景蒙上阴影，德州仪器股价下挫
item.description: 德州仪器（Texas Instruments）的股价在周三的盘前交易中暴跌近 12%，因为该公司的季度利润预测显示，其模拟芯片的需求受到打击，这激起了投资者对关税相关干扰的担忧。【原文：Texas Instruments shares slumped nearly 12% in premarket trading on Wednesday, after its quarterly profit forecast indicated a hit to demand for its analog chips that stoked investor fears of tariff-related disruptions.】

item.title: 洞察力：大麻饮料抢夺销量，大型酒业公司准备反击
item.description: 顶级酒类制造商在大麻饮料热潮中一直袖手旁观，眼睁睁地看着 Cann 和 Wynk 等快速增长的大麻饮料品牌与啤酒和烈酒经销商达成交易，并在酒类商店的货架上获得宝贵的空间。【原文：Top alcohol makers have been sitting on the sidelines of a cannabis beverage boom, watching brands in the fast-growing category like Cann and Wynk make deals with beer and booze distributors, and gain valuable space on liquor store shelves.】

item.title: 德国研究显示，中国低估人民币汇率助长欧元区贸易逆差
item.description: 德国经济研究所（German Economic Institute）的一项研究表明，由于中国涉嫌操纵货币以保持人民币弱势，欧洲企业正面临着越来越大的压力，而欧盟领导人正在北京筹备旨在解决贸易争端的峰会。【原文：European companies are facing increasing pressure due to China's alleged currency manipulation to keep its yuan weak, a study by the German Economic Institute showed, as EU leaders prepared for a summit in Beijing aimed at navigating trade disputes.】

item.title: 中国公安部表示将加入加强对辅助驾驶监管的行列
item.description: 中国公安部周三表示，将与工业部和其他管理机构合作，加强对辅助驾驶系统的监管。【原文：China's public security ministry on Wednesday said it will cooperate with the industry ministry and other governing bodies to tighten regulation related to assisted driving systems.】

item.title: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局（NHTSA）称，因头枕问题，Stellantis 将召回超过 12 万辆美国汽车
item.description: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局（U.S. National Highway Traffic Safety Administration）周三表示，克莱斯勒母公司斯特兰蒂斯公司（Stellantis）将在美国召回121398辆汽车，原因是这些汽车的头枕可能无法正常锁定，在发生碰撞时会增加乘员受伤的风险。【原文：Chrysler parent Stellantis is recalling 121,398 vehicles in the U.S. due to head restraints that may not lock properly and an increased risk of injury to the seat occupant during a crash, the U.S. National Highway Traffic Safety Administration said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 政治和财政风险上升，买家逃离日本债券
item.description: 日本政府债券暴跌，基准收益率升至近 17 年高点，原因是交易商对政治风险增加和央行政策正常化路径前景不明进行了定价。【原文：Japanese government bonds tumbled, sending benchmark yields to near 17-year highs, as traders priced in increased political risks and a hazy outlook for the central bank's policy normalisation path.】

item.title: 奢侈品巨头努力摆脱购物疲劳
item.description: 预计路威酩轩集团（LVMH）和开云集团（Kering）将公布季度销售额再次下滑的报告，这加深了投资者对这个价值 4000 亿美元的奢侈品市场长期低迷的担忧，因为各品牌都面临着美国高额进口关税的威胁。【原文：LVMH and Kering are expected to report another drop in quarterly sales, deepening investor worries about a prolonged downturn in the $400 billion luxury market as brands face the threat of hefty U.S. import tariffs.】

item.title: 共同社报道：日本称与美国的贸易协议不包括外汇
item.description: 据共同社周三报道，日本财务大臣加藤胜信（Katsunobu Kato）表示，与美国达成的双边贸易协议并未提及外汇汇率。【原文：Japanese Finance Minister Katsunobu Kato said the bilateral trade deal with the United States did not include reference to foreign exchange rates, Kyodo news agency reported on Wednesday.】

item.title: 美日达成贸易协议后欧洲汽车股上涨
item.description: 东京与美国达成贸易协议后，多家欧洲汽车制造商的股票在周三早盘交易中上涨，追随着一些亚洲竞争对手的大幅反弹，这助长了对与欧洲达成类似协议的乐观情绪。【原文：Shares in several European carmakers rose in early trade on Wednesday, tracking a steep rally in some of their Asian rivals, after Tokyo struck a trade deal with the United States, fuelling optimism for a similar agreement with Europe.】

item.title: 特朗普称日美将组建液化天然气合资企业
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）周二表示，日本将组建合资企业在阿拉斯加开发液化天然气项目，但一位日本政府官员表示他并不知道有这样的计划。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump said on Tuesday that Japan will form a joint venture to develop a liquefied natural gas project in Alaska though a Japanese government official said he was not aware of such plans.】

item.title: SAP 第二季度财报发布后股价走低
item.description: 德国软件制造商 SAP 周三开盘下跌 1.6%，原因是该公司公布的第二季度财报显示，成本削减推动了业绩增长，但该公司并未如一些投资者所希望的那样上调全年目标。【原文：Shares in German software maker SAP were seen opening 1.6% lower on Wednesday after the company reported a second quarter boosted by cost cuts but held off on increasing full-year targets as hoped by some investors.】

item.title: Equinor 对美国海上风电减记 9.55 亿美元
item.description: 挪威埃奎诺公司（Equinor）周三表示，尽管美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）政府取消了早些时候对美国海上风电项目的建设禁令，但该公司仍对美国的一个海上风电项目计提了9.55亿美元的减值。【原文：Norway's Equinor said on Wednesday it booked a $955 million impairment on an offshore wind project in the United States, despite the lifting of an earlier ban on its construction by President Donald Trump's administration.】

item.title: 英国《金融时报》：亚马逊关闭上海人工智能研究实验室
item.description: 据英国《金融时报》周三报道，亚马逊正在关闭其上海人工智能实验室。【原文：Amazon is shutting down its Shanghai artificial intelligence lab, the Financial Times reported on Wednesday.】

item.title: PayPal 将推出与印度 UPI 支付系统连接的跨境平台
item.description: 支付公司贝宝（PayPal）与印度流行的统一支付界面运营商等合作推出了一个全球平台，消费者可以通过该平台向企业进行跨境支付。【原文：Payments firm PayPal has partnered with the operator of India’s popular unified payments interface and others to launch a global platform through which consumers can make cross-border payments to businesses.】

item.title: 裕信银行利润意外大增，放弃竞购 Banco BPM 后上调业绩指引
item.description: 意大利联合信贷银行（UniCredit）周三公布了远高于预期的季度利润，并上调了 2025 年的业绩展望，此前一天，该银行放弃了对竞争对手 Banco BPM 的收购要约，这曾导致意大利第二大银行与政府发生冲突。【原文：UniCredit on Wednesday posted a much higher than expected quarterly profit and raised its 2025 outlook, a day after ditching a takeover bid for rival Banco BPM which had led Italy's second biggest bank to clash with the government.】

item.title: 招聘公司 Randstad 第二季度核心利润符合市场预期
item.description: 荷兰招聘公司 Randstad 周三公布的第二季度核心利润符合市场预期，理由是一些关键市场有所改善、招聘外包需求增加以及成本进一步降低。【原文：Dutch recruiter Randstad reported a second-quarter core profit in line with market expectations on Wednesday, citing improvements in some key markets, increased recruitment outsourcing demand and further cost reductions.】

item.title: 防务需求强劲，泰雷兹上调 2025 年销售额增长预期
item.description: 由于欧洲军费开支增加，法国防务和航空航天集团泰雷兹（Thales）周三上调了 2025 年销售增长预期，此前该集团公布的上半年销售和利润均有所增长。【原文：French defence and aerospace group Thales raised its 2025 sales growth forecast on Wednesday after posting higher first-half sales and profit amid higher military spending in Europe.】

item.title: 雷诺第二季度销量持平，面包车需求下降
item.description: 本周三，雷诺公布了第二季度销售量零增长的报告，此前欧洲对货车需求的骤降抵消了乘用车的增长。【原文：Renault reported zero growth in second-quarter sales volume on Wednesday, after a plunge in demand for vans in Europe offset growth in passenger cars.】

item.title: Equinor 第二季度核心利润因油价下跌而如期下降
item.description: Equinor 公司周三发布的财报显示，由于油价下跌超过了天然气价格的上涨，该公司第二季度利润较上年同期下降了 13%，符合预期。【原文：Equinor's second-quarter profit fell as expected by 13% from a year earlier, its earnings report showed on Wednesday, as declining oil prices outweighed a rise in the price of gas.】

item.title: 早间竞标日本意外达成贸易协定让其他国家燃起希望
item.description: Stella Qiu 对欧洲和全球市场未来一天的展望【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Stella Qiu】

item.title: 台湾计划通过人工智能项目推动经济增长 5100 亿美元
item.description: 台湾计划推出 "十大人工智能基础设施项目"，旨在到 2040 年创造超过 15 万亿新台币（约合 5100 亿美元）的经济价值，努力成为人工智能领域的全球领导者。【原文：Taiwan plans to launch its "Ten Major AI Infrastructure Projects" initiative, aimed at generating more than T$15 trillion ($510 billion) in economic value by 2040 as it strives to become a global leader in artificial intelligence.】

item.title: 英国《金融时报》报道：麦肯锡禁止中国业务参与生成式人工智能咨询工作
item.description: 英国《金融时报》周三援引两位知情人士的话报道称，麦肯锡已停止在中国开展与人工智能相关的咨询工作。【原文：McKinsey has stopped its China business from undertaking consultancy work related to generative artificial intelligence, the Financial Times reported on Wednesday, citing two people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 日本承诺在免关税配额内进口更多美国大米
item.description: 日本首相石破茂（Shigeru Ishiba）周三表示，日本将从美国进口更多大米，但不超过现有的免关税配额，并强调东京在达成双边贸易协议时成功地保护了农业部门。【原文：Japan will import more rice from the United States but within the existing tariff-free quota, Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba said on Wednesday, stressing Tokyo's success in protecting the agricultural sector in agreeing a bilateral trade deal.】

item.title: 亚行称美国关税和贸易紧张局势将减缓亚太发展中国家的经济增长
item.description: 亚洲开发银行（Asian Development Bank）周三在一份报告中称，美国提高关税和贸易的不确定性恶化了亚太地区发展中国家的经济前景，该行同时下调了亚太地区今明两年的经济增长预期。【原文：Higher U.S. tariffs and trade uncertainty have worsened the economic outlook for developing Asia and the Pacific, the Asian Development Bank said in a report on Wednesday as it lowered its growth forecasts for the region for this year and next.】
